WHY.title: Why create Projects.directory?
WHY.des: In any organization with more than twenty members, it's hard to know who does what and what anyone's working on right now. We started Projects to let {link} users share their projects and initiatives between students, researchers, staff members and teachers.
WHY.des1: In an interdisciplinary environment, you cannot rely on top-down communication only : people need to talk, to discover other projects relevant to their work, to be inspired by cool projects that make sense for themselves and the planet. So we built a platform to let anyone display his/her own projects and passions to their community and to the world.
WHY.des2: It was soon obvious that ANY organization has similar needs. So we let other groups share their own projects (NGOs, universities...) on their own portals, while all projects where shared on a {link}. We got the support of the French Ministry of Education, the City of Paris, the Île-de-France Region, the Université de Paris and many others.

GOAL.title: Where do we go from there?
GOAL.des: CRI and UNESCO co-created {lpiLink}, an initiative to transform education on a worldwide scale. #LearningPlanet is a global open alliance of educational stakeholders and learning communities with a cause, with the mission to inspire & empower learners of all ages to contribute to shaping better futures. Our aim is to foster collaboration between thousands of actors of education and create a digital ecosystem to help them learn better together
GOAL.des1: Projects.directory is the most mature tool of this digital ecosystem. We hope that any organization focused on solving sustainable development goals will use it to share their projects and initiatives.
GOAL.des2: Projects.directory leverages collective and artificial intelligence from the {weLearnLink} initiative and the {skillLink} project.

groups.intro: Register links allow users who want to create a Projects account on your portal to do so. All you need to do is share with them the link. Many people can subscribe using one link.   You can control what group they will be part of when creating the link.

groups.subtitle-edit-child: Select in the list the parent group. You can only select one.

form.groups-description: This user will be part of the following groups

password-reset.error: Error while sending password reset link

groups.title: User role
groups.users: User: a user is part of your community. They can create projects, edit their projects, and write comments on any project. They see a private project when they are part of the team of this projects, they see all projects with the community visibility, and all public projects.
groups.facilitators: Facilitator: This role is for teachers or tutors: They see all private projects in the portal and they can edit them. They also have all the rights of Users.
groups.admins: Org admin: This role allows to configure your portal and manage users in your portal. Org admins have access to the admin menu of the portal to set up the portal and manage its users. They also have all the rights of Facilitators.
groups.none: None: This person has a Projects account but is not part of your portal. They can only see the public projects.

HEADER.title: Share your projects
HEADER.des: Use the Projects platform to showcase your projects,

FEATURES.title: Get Inspired
FEATURES.des: Discover many interesting projects not only{0}through our powerful search but also based on{0}AI recommendations, location, or thematic map.

list.title: Recommandations
list.des: Hop from one  project to  similar ones thanks to projects linked by team members, or through automatic project recommendations.

list.title: Tag Map
list.des: Use our tag map to discover projects in a totally new way! It groups projects according to how similar their tags are. The tags are Wikipedia articles.

list.title: Geographic Map
list.des: Explore projects on the world map by team location and by place where the project had an impact.

FEATURES.title: Share and Collaborate
FEATURES.des: Create efficiently a rich presentation of your project,{0}and increase your impact by joining forces.

list.des: Edit your project description simultaneously with your team members to add formatted text, images, videos, and links through a user-friendly text editor.
Easily recruit participants or contributors by broadcasting the information to the whole community through public announcements.
Add Sustainable Development Goals you contribute to so that users can find your project based on this information.
Exchange with community members through the comments section.
Complete your project with any type of external ressources, whether they are inspirations, creations, documentations,  other related projects...
Let others follow your project, or share it by a simple link

FEATURES.title: TEACH
FEATURES.des: Use functionnalities specifically designed for teaching project-based courses.

list.title: CUSTOM PROJECT TEMPLATES
list.des: Guide a project creator so that the content of their project corresponds to your expectations.

list.title: EASY REVIEWING OF STUDENT PROJECTS
list.des: Create reviews and approve the publication of your students' projects.

FEATURES.title: MANAGE YOUR COMMUNITY
FEATURES.des: Create an instance of Projects just for your community.{0}And enjoy the flexibility we offer to manage it, hassle free.

list.title: PERSONNALIZED PORTAL
list.des: Personnalize everything: Put your images, logos, titles, create your own categories, tags.

list.title: EASY ADMINISTRATION AND MODERATION
list.des: Anytime, manage options for your community through the community admin space,  and moderate projects on your portal with admin rights.

list.title: Clickable projects on your website
list.des: If your community has a website, you can embed easily projects that you want to feature there. When users click on it, they will be redirected to Projects.

PROJECT.title: Follow the PROJECTS Platform
PROJECT.des: Discover everything about the Projects platform in its very own project.

project.title: CRI Projects
project.des: Créer un annuaire des projets d'une organisation avec les ressources et compétences mobilisées

project.title: INTERNSHIP L3 - CEEBIOS _ Elise Buard
project.des: Bachelor's degree internship semester FdV. In charge of the formations of Biomimicry in France.

list.title: For education
list.des: Project-based courses, internships, student associations, self-study, etc.
list.quote: The Projects  platform allowed me to communicate about the results of all that I did for my internship.{0}The comments section allowed readers to ask for more information and to give me their thoughts on what they would like to read.{0}I was able to create my own illustrated logbook and this allowed my readers to discover precisely the implementation and expansion of biomimicry
list.author: - Elise Buard, Bachelor Student, Internship CEEBIOS

list.title: For research
list.des: Research labs, citizen science initiatives, open-source challenges.
list.quote: High impact research tends to be interdisciplinary, with multiple stakeholders involved in its co-construction. But far too often knowledge and communities are siloed in disciplines, and communication with other stakeholders is difficult. The Projects platform helps to easily showcase impactful research, to easily find collaborators across disciplines, and to easily collaborate with the stakeholders that need your research.
list.author: - Ignacio Atal, Profs Chercheurs

project.title: EcoloVie
project.des: Réduire l'impact écologique de notre famille

list.title: For personal SDG projects
list.des: Independent collectives and activists tackling critical social challenges.
list.quote: Our project: become an eco-responsible family. With the Projects platform, we can easily share our actions about food, transportation, housing, recycling and buying practices, and hopefully inspire others to change, one household at a time!
list.author: - Anne Mistral, family member

tab1.title: Get Inspired
tab1.text: Discover interesting and inspiring projects. Browse projects on the geographic map and the tag map. Search by title, team member or project tag.

tab2.title: Share
tab2.text: Easily document and share your projects with all visitors and within your community. Add to your project a description, external resources, goals, tags, and blog entries.

tab3.title: Collaborate
tab3.text: Collaboratively edit your project with your team members. Set up announcements to recruit participants (contributors, new team members, interns, workers, etc.), exchange comments with community members.

tab4.title: Show your impact
tab4.text: Increase impact worldwide and showcase inspiring efforts for common good. Identify which {sdg} you contribute to. Geolocalise all the places where your projects generate an impact.

onboarding.tab-1-text: Discover interesting and inspiring projects. Browse projects on the geographic map and the tag map. Search by title, team member or project tag.
onboarding.tab-2-text: Easily document and share your projects with all visitors and within your community. Add to your project a description, external resources, goals, tags, and blog entries.
onboarding.tab-3-text: Collaboratively edit your project with your team members. Set up announcements to recruit participants (contributors, new team members, interns, workers, etc.), exchange comments with community members.
onboarding.tab-4-text: Increase impact worldwide and showcase inspiring efforts for common good. Identify which SDGs you contribute to. Geolocalise all the places where your projects generate an impact.

tip.intro-edit: The different levels you can choose from:

basic.title: Level 2: Basic
basic.description: High-school level, or did some tutorial, or a small project

competent.title: Level 3: Competent
competent.description: Master-level or did an intermediate project, or can teach to licence level

expert.title: Level 4: Expert
expert.description: PhD-level or did a big project, or can teach to master level

profile.skill_guide: 1 bar: Curious. You're interested, but you do not have any specific skills in it.{0}2 bars: Basic. Bachelor level, or did a basic project{0}3 bars: Competent. Master level, or did an intermediate project, or can teach to Bachelor level.{0}4 bars: Expert. PHD, or did a substantial part of a complex project, or can teach advanced courses in master or to professionals.

org-settings.title: Portal(s) of the portal
org-settings.description: The project belongs to the selected portals. Beware when you add or modify the portals your project belongs to. For instance, admins of a new organisation are automatically granted access to your project. Or organisations may have specific editorial rules that you should follow.
org-settings.warning: Your project belongs to the organizations below. You can edit the category of your project there:

project.team-location-hint: Locate your project team(s) main location(s)
project.title: project title
project.type-hint: Changing the base type of a project can have implications on its visibility. Use this with caution.
project.unauthorized-access: Oops, something went wrong while accessing this project...
project.unauthorized-access1: Do you have the rights to access this project? Has this project been deleted?
project.unauthorized-access2: You'll be automatically redirected in 5 seconds.

updated.blog-entry: updated a blog entry of this project
updated.blog-entry-create: added a new blog entry of this project
updated.category: updated the category this project's category

project.upload_title: Add downloadable files to your project.
project.use_h1h2: Easy! Just use the H1 / H2 options ( heading level 1 / heading level 2 ) in the editor.{0} A table of content will be automatically generated.
project.tag-warning: NB: If a user switches languages in your portal, the tags with translations will we translated for them. Otherwise, the tags will be shown in English.

recruit.about-you: Tell us about yourself and what motivates you
recruit.delete-announcement-message: Do you want to delete this announcement ?
recruit.email: Warning, we need a valid email address to contact you. (We will not save this information on the platform).
recruit.motivation-hint: It should contain at least 20 characters
recruit.title: Title

report.abuse-title: Explain the report in a few words.
report.abuse-text: Describe as precisely as possible why you report this project.
report.abuse-url: Copy paste the URL of the page you want to report.
report.bug-title: Explain the bug in a few words.
report.bug-text: Describe as precisely as possible the issue you've experienced and how to reproduce to reproduce it.
report.bug-url: Copy paste the URL of the page where you add this issue.

resource.add-success: This resource has been successfully added
resource.invalid-image: Unsupported file ... is this an image ?
resource.no-resource: No resource has been added yet ...
resource.purpose: Why do you link this resource to your project ?
resource.web: link to web resources | links to web resources
resource.web-link: web link | web link | web links

restriction.private: Only members of the project can view it.
restriction.org: Only members of its community can view it

visibility.public: visible to any visitor, even without an account.
visibility.community: visible only to users who have an account on this portal.

register.title: Create an account

email.label: Email *
email.is-invalid: This is not a valid email

register.confirmation: We sent you a confirmation email in your inbox. Once you have confirmed that {email} is your email, we’ll help you get started on the platform.
register.save-error: A technical problem occured. Please retry later.
register.tos: By continuing, you agree to our {term} and {privacy}

role.role-editor: Has all edit rights for this group.
role.role-reviewer: When the project has been marked as 'ready for review', the reviewer can give feedback, and can lock a project to prevent further edits in the project. A reviewer also has edit rights.
role.role-teammate: He has no edit rights, but appears as member of the team.
role.label: with the role
role.role-leader: Is an Editor who will appear with a “Group Leader” tag.
role.role-member: Appears as group member. Their projects appear among the projects of the group.

search.banner-portal: You can also search for projects of all communities on
search.subtitle-ambiguous-tag: This tag has different meanings. Select the one you are interested in:
search.choose: choose among main tags or search for tags
search.info: You can also search projects from every communities on
search.geo-map-description: Discover projects on a world map
search.tag-map-description: Discover projetcs on a Wikipédia tag map
search.current-tag-description: Type tag’s first letters and select the right tag
search.current-skill-description: Type skill’s first letters and select the right skill

1.title: No Poverty
1.description: End poverty in all its forms everywhere

2.title: Zero Hunger
2.description: End hunger, achieve food security and improved nutrition and promote sustainable agriculture

3.title: Good Health and Well-Being
3.description: Ensure healthy lives and promote well-being for all at all ages

4.title: Quality Education
4.description: Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all

5.title: Gender Equality
5.description: Achieve gender equality and empower all women and girls

6.title: Clean Water and Sanitation
6.description: Ensure availability and sustainable management of water and sanitation for all

7.title: Affordable and Clean Energy
7.description: Ensure access to affordable, reliable, sustainable and modern energy for all

8.title: Decent Work and Economic Growth
8.description: Promote sustained, inclusive and sustainable economic growth, full and productive employment and decent work for all

9.title: Industry, Innovation and Infrastructure
9.description: Build resilient infrastructure, promote inclusive and sustainable industrialization and foster innovation

10.title: Reduced Inequalities
10.description: Reduce inequality within and among countries

11.title: Sustainable Cities and Communities
11.description: Make cities and human settlements inclusive, safe, resilient and sustainable

12.title: Responsible Consumption and Production
12.description: Ensure sustainable consumption and production patterns

13.title: Climate Action
13.description: Take urgent action to combat climate change and its impacts

14.title: Life Below Water
14.description: Conserve and sustainably use the oceans, seas and marine resources for sustainable development

15.title: Life on Land
15.description: Protect, restore and promote sustainable use of terrestrial ecosystems, sustainably manage forests, combat desertification, and halt and reverse land degradation and halt biodiversity loss

16.title: Peace, Justice and Strong Institutions
16.description: Promote peaceful and inclusive societies for sustainable development, provide access to justice for all and build effective, accountable and inclusive institutions at all levels

17.title: Partnerships for the Goals
17.description: Strengthen the means of implementation and revitalize the global partnership for sustainable development

status.title: What is the project life status ?

tag.add-specific-info: These tags make it possible to organize projects in addition to categories (examples: “Master 2 LiSc”, “MAT001”, “school year 2022-2023”, etc.). They are specific to your organization. They are useful for filtering your projects in the search.
tag.add-wiki: Put tags forward to link projects by theme
tag.add-wiki-info: When a user creates a project, they can add a thematic tag from Wikipedia (e.g. biochemistry, physics, etc.). This makes it easier to find the project and improve project recommendations by thematic similarity. You can highlight important thematic tags for your organization.
tag.info: When creating a project, users can tag it with Wikipedia tags (ex: biology, physics, etc). It helps to easily find projects, organize them by subject and improve referencing. You can showcase wikipedia tags that are important to your organization and also create tags specific to your portal that do not exist in Wikipedia. This feature is restricted to admins.
tag.no-tags: You do not suggest any tags
tag.no-wiki-tags: You do not suggest any thematic tags
tag.no-specific-tags: You do not suggest any organizational tags
tag.title: Tags

team.no-user-message: No user corresponds to your search
team.remove-user-confirm: Are you sure you want to delete this user from the project?
team.remove-group-confirm: Are you sure you want to delete this group from the project?

template.info: If you want to suggest to users how to organise their project in a specific category, you can create a template for that category. Then, when a user will create a project in that category, the project will be initialised with the text that you defined in the template. This text is meant as a guide to users.
template.no-tag-set: No tag has been set for now.
template.title: Templates
template.tips-category: Select a category to which your template will apply.

tips.background-color: This color will be displayed behind the text.
tips.category-delete: You can only delete a category if the category does not contain any projects. Please transfer all the projects in the category to other categories.
tips.category-image: Image used to illustrate a category. It is not required if you would rather simply display a colour. Minimum width: 1024pxpx, Minimum height: 400pxpx
tips.limit-publication-to-reviewers: Do you want to limit the publication of projects to reviewers ?
tips.organization-name: This name will be used to identify your community in community-specific pages (e.g: statistics page).
tips.organization-title: The title of your portal will appear on the banner of your welcome page. Preview above.
tips.organization-motto: What motto characterises the ideology of your organization? Preview above.
tips.organization-language: The language by default of your portal.
tips.organization-visibility: Do you want a link to your portal from the main portal of Projects?
tips.organization-logo: Your logo will appear on the parent portal on a white background. If the logo you previously uploaded is not compatible with a white background, please choose a background colour below.
tips.text-color: This is the text color displayed over the background color.

projects.title: Notifications that you receive by email:
projects.follow-sub: Be notified when projects that you have follow are modified
projects.member-sub: Be notified when somebody adds you as a team member in a project
projects.comment-sub: Be notified when somebody comments your project
projects.project-sub: Be notified when other team members modify your projects
projects.announcement-sub: Be notified when new announcements are published on the website
projects.review-sub: When you are a reviewer of a project, be notified when a project is ready to be reviewed by you
projects.reviewed-sub: When your project is ready for review, be notified when the reviewer of your project has submitted his review
projects.reply-sub: Be notified when somebody replies to your comment

type.ready_for_review: {sender} marked his project as ready for review. You can now review project {project}
type.group_member_added: {sender} added the group {group} as member to the project {project}
type.group_member_added_self: {sender} added the group {group} you are part of to project {project}
type.group_member_removed_other: {sender} removed a group from members of project {project}
type.group_member_removed: {sender} removed a group from members of project {project}
type.member_updated_self: Your role in the project {project} has been updated by {sender}
type.member_added: {sender} added a member to the project {project}
type.member_updated: {sender} updated the role of {user} in the project {project}
type.member_removed: {sender} removed {user} from the team of the project {project}
type.announcement: {sender} published a new announcement in the project {project}
type.application: {applicant} applied to your announcement {announcement} in the project {project}
type.blog_entry: {sender} published a new blog entry in the project {project}
type.invitation_today_reminder: A {link} you created for the group {today_group} will expire today
type.invitation_week_reminder: A {link} you created for the group {week_group} will expire in a week

socket.error-text: You will not be able to edit your project because we cannot connect to the socket server. This might be due to the quality of your internet connection.
